intro: Sisymbrium brevicaule, commonly known as narrowleaf babylon weed, is an annual flowering plant native to Eurasia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are alternate, linear to elliptic, and often have a hairy texture. Sisymbrium brevicaule is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in fields and along roadsides.
